contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox chess player |name = Zaven Andriasian |image = Zaven Andriasian 2012.jpg |caption = Zaven Andriasian, Warsaw 2012 |birthname = Զավեն Անդրիասյան |country = Armenia |birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1989|3|11}} |birth_place = |death_date = |death_place = |title = [[Grandmaster (chess)|Grandmaster]] |worldchampion = |womensworldchampion = |peakrating = 2645 (March 2011) |FideID = 13302000 }} '''Zaven Andriasian''' (sometimes [[Transliteration|transliterated]] as Andriasyan; {{lang-hy|Զավեն Անդրիասյան}}; born March 11, 1989)<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.mikacc.am/ratings/2009-2/index7b41.htm|title=Ratings of Chess Players of Armenia by November 1, 2009|publisher=MIKA Chess Club|accessdate=19 December 2009}}</ref> is an [[Armenia]]n [[Grandmaster (chess)|Grandmaster]] (2006) of [[chess]]. He won the 2005 [[European Youth Chess Championship]] for under 16<ref>[http://www.chessbase.com/newsdetail.asp?newsid=2653 ChessBase.com - Chess News - European Youth Championship the winners]</ref> and the 2006 [[World Junior Chess Championship]].<ref>[http://www.chessbase.com/newsdetail.asp?newsid=3432 ChessBase.com - Chess News - Shen Yang and Zaven Andriasian World Junior Champions]</ref> In November 2010 he won the Russian Cup Final after defeating [[Artyom Timofeev]] in the second game of the final.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.chess.co.uk/twic/twic837.html#10|title=The Week in Chess 837: Russian Cup Final 2010|last=Crowther|first=Mark|date=2010-11-22|publisher=London Chess Center|accessdate=13 November 2011}}</ref> In January 2012 he came second in the Armenian [[Chess960]] Championship.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.panarmenian.net/eng/news/90416/Hrant_Melkumyan_becomes_Armenias_Chess_960_champion_of_2012|title=Hrant Melkumyan becomes Armenia’s Chess 960 champion of 2012|date=2012-01-28|publisher=PanArmenian.net|accessdate=29 January 2012}}</ref> In December 2012 he tied for 1st-3rd with [[Alexander Kovchan]] and [[Sipke Ernst]] in the [[Groningen]] Chess Festival.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.theweekinchess.com/chessnews/events/50th-groningen-chess-festival-2012|title= The Week in Chess: 50th Groningen Chess Festival 2012|last=Crowther|first=Mark|date=2012.12.31|publisher=The Week in Chess|accessdate=2 January 2013}}</ref> He defeated German grandmaster [[Falko Bindrich]] in the 2007 World Youth Stars tournament in a notably strong game. '''1. Nf3 d5 2. d4 Nf6 3. c4 c6 4. e3 e6 5. Nbd2 c5 6. cxd5 exd5 7. Be2 Nc6 8. dxc5 Bxc5 9. O-O O-O 10. a3 a5 11. Nb3 Bb6 12. Bd2 Ne4 13. Be1 Bg4 14. Nfd4 Bxe2 15. Nxe2 Re8 16. Qd3 Qd6 17. Rd1 Bc7 18. g3 Rad8 19. Nc3 Ne5 20. Qe2 Qe6 21. Kg2 b6 22. Nd4 Qg6 23. Ncb5 Bb8 24. Rc1 h5 25. h3 Nc5 26. Rd1 Ned3 27. Nf3 Nf4'''<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.chessgames.com/perl/chessgame?gid=1461237 | title=Falko Bindrich vs Zaven Andriasian, World Youth Stars 2007, Semi-Slav Defense: Quiet Variation (D30), 0-1 | publisher=[[Chessgames.com]] | accessdate=2013-04-18}}</ref> {{As of|2013|1}}, his [[FIDE]] rating is 2598. ==References== <references/> ==Notable games== *[http://www.chessgames.com/perl/chessgame?gid=1432759, Zaven Andriasian vs Maxim Rodshtein, World Junior Championship 2006, French Defense: Tarrasch Variation, Chistyakov Defense Modern Line (C07), 1-0] *[http://www.chessgames.com/perl/chessgame?gid=1461237, Falko Bindrich vs Zaven Andriasian, World Youth Stars 2007, Semi-Slav Defense: Quiet Variation (D30), 0-1] ==External links== *{{Chessgames player|id=84227}} *{{chessclub player|id=ZavenGrozny}} *[http://www.redhotpawn.com/chess/grandmaster-games/index.php?player=Zaven_Andriasian&masterplayerid=20925 Grandmaster Games Database - Zaven Andriasian] *[http://chess.vrsac.com/search/player_e.asp?FC=13302000 Rating data] {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Andriasian, Zaven | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION =Chess [[Grandmaster (chess)|Grandmaster]] | DATE OF BIRTH =1989-03-11 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Andriasian, Zaven}} [[Category:1989 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Chess grandmasters]] [[Category:Armenian chess players]] [[Category:Sportspeople from Yerevan]] [[Category:World Junior Chess Champions]] {{Armenia-chess-bio-stub}}
